newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends weaker on dollar shortfall.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends weaker on dollar shortfall.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka closed weaker at 43.7490/7498 to the dollar in interbank trading on Thursday on short supply of the U.S. currency, dealers said.
The taka was quoted weaker at 43.7480/7500 to the dollar in early trading and slipped further later in the day.
The call money was traded at 6.5 to seven percent against previous 6.25-6.75 percent.
Banks in Bangladesh close transactions by midday on Thursday.
